title: Starting Fire with a Convex Lens
brief: Use sunlight focused through a lens to ignite tinder on bright, sunny days.
steps: Step 1: Gather a convex lens from binoculars, camera, telescopic sight, or magnifying glass.
Step 2: Prepare very dry, fine tinder in your fire lay.
Step 3: Angle the lens to concentrate the sun's rays into a small, bright spot on the tinder.
Step 4: Hold the lens steady over the same spot until the tinder begins to smoke and smolder.
Step 5: Once smoldering starts, gently blow or fan the tinder to encourage flame.
Step 6: Quickly apply the flaming tinder to your prepared fire lay.
warnings: Only works on bright, sunny days with direct sunlight.
Do not look directly at the concentrated light beam as it can damage your eyes.
Keep the focused beam steady - moving it around will prevent ignition.
Have your fire lay completely prepared before attempting ignition.
